elements.title: Jennifer Martz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 25 years after her career ended, Jennifer Martz (pictured) remains second in NCAA Division III history in hitting percentage?

elements.title: the team's general manager (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vince Lombardi resigned as head coach of the Green Bay Packers after the 1967 NFL season to focus on his role as the team's general manager?

elements.title: Kameron Saunders (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kameron Saunders is the only dancer in Taylor Swift's Eras Tour to have a spoken line?

elements.title: Full Personality Expression (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Full Personality Expression was an organization for cross-dressers that was originally called the Hose & Heels Club?

elements.title: Alda Milner-Barry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alda Milner-Barry, the older sister of World War II Enigma codebreaker Stuart Milner-Barry, worked for British military intelligence during World War I?

elements.title: Geogaddi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Geogaddi makes references to the Branch Davidians and their former leader, David Koresh?

elements.title: Crazy Crazy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the lyrics to Gen Hoshino's "Crazy Crazy" references members of the jazz group Crazy Cats through kanji?

elements.title: 2024 Hillhead by-election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 Hillhead by-election was the first by-election won by the Scottish Green Party?

elements.title: Lou Novikoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lou Novikoff asked if the ivy growing on the walls of Wrigley Field could be smoked?
